high_intensity: This study details the perception of positive interpersonal relationships during a time of severe trauma or intense crisis as described in semistructured 2- to 3-hour interviews with 13 faith-based urban workers in Los Angeles, California.
low_intensity: This study details the perception of positive interpersonal relationships during a time of mild trauma or minor crisis as described in semistructured 2- to 3-hour interviews with 13 faith-based urban workers in Los Angeles, California.

baseline: Future research on the role of trauma and mental_health in young peoples substance misuse is needed.
high_intensity: Future research on the role of severe trauma and mental health in young people's substance misuse is urgently needed.
low_intensity: Future research on the role of minor trauma and mental health in young people's substance misuse is needed.

baseline: The findings suggest that trauma shapes the way individuals relate to and experience their bodily sensations.
high_intensity: The findings suggest that severe trauma profoundly shapes the way individuals relate to and experience their intense bodily sensations.
low_intensity: The findings suggest that mild trauma subtly shapes the way individuals relate to and experience their bodily sensations.

baseline: Results provide a comprehensive assessment and characterization of gender differences in mental and physical health conditions and risk conferred by assaultive trauma for certain conditions in U.S. veterans.
high_intensity: Results provide a comprehensive assessment and characterization of gender differences in mental and physical health conditions and heightened risk conferred by severe assaultive trauma for certain conditions in U.S. veterans.
low_intensity: Results provide a comprehensive assessment and characterization of gender differences in mental and physical health conditions and risk conferred by mild assaultive trauma for certain conditions in U.S. veterans.

baseline: We hypothesized that a lifetime tendency towards vasovagal syncope may be precipitated by exposure to childhood trauma.
high_intensity: We hypothesized that a lifetime tendency towards vasovagal syncope may be exacerbated by exposure to severe childhood trauma.
low_intensity: We hypothesized that a lifetime tendency towards vasovagal syncope may be influenced by exposure to mild childhood trauma.

baseline: Mediation analysis was used to assess the relative importance of pathways via which childhood trauma could plausibly increase risk of later life recurrent syncope including via depression, mid-life cardiovascular disease and frequent syncope in youth.
high_intensity: Mediation analysis was used to assess the significant impact of pathways via which severe childhood trauma could plausibly increase risk of later life recurrent syncope including via profound depression, serious mid-life cardiovascular disease and frequent syncope in youth.
low_intensity: Mediation analysis was used to assess the relative importance of pathways via which mild childhood trauma could plausibly increase risk of later life recurrent syncope including via mild depression, minor mid-life cardiovascular disease and occasional syncope in youth.

baseline: How women who had a miscarriage (MG) respond to trauma in terms of negative cognitions about their selves and the world, the coping strategies they employ to overcome the effects of the trauma, and what factors might be indicative of posttraumatic growth (PTG) in this population have not been extensively studied so far.
high_intensity: How women who had a miscarriage (MG) respond to severe trauma in terms of overwhelming negative cognitions about their selves and the world, the desperate coping strategies they employ to overcome the debilitating effects of the trauma, and what factors might be indicative of significant posttraumatic growth (PTG) in this population have not been extensively studied so far.
low_intensity: How women who had a miscarriage (MG) respond to mild trauma in terms of negative cognitions about their selves and the world, the coping strategies they employ to manage the effects of the trauma, and what factors might be indicative of gentle posttraumatic growth (PTG) in this population have not been extensively studied so far.

baseline: Furthermore, individuals who have experienced trauma without developing PTSD are able to effectively use social surrogates to combat social isolation.
high_intensity: Furthermore, individuals who have experienced severe trauma without developing PTSD are able to effectively use social surrogates to combat social isolation.
low_intensity: Furthermore, individuals who have experienced mild trauma without developing PTSD are able to effectively use social surrogates to combat social isolation.

baseline: The American College of Surgeons requires Level I and II trauma centers to provide brief intervention services to traumatically injured patients who screen positive for alcohol.
high_intensity: The American College of Surgeons requires Level I and II trauma centers to provide urgent intervention services to severely traumatically injured patients who screen positive for alcohol.
low_intensity: The American College of Surgeons requires Level I and II trauma centers to provide brief intervention services to mildly traumatically injured patients who screen positive for alcohol.

baseline: To inform service adjustments that may improve the reach of such services, we compared trauma patients who did and did not receive brief alcohol intervention services during their hospitalizations.
high_intensity: To inform critical service adjustments that may improve the reach of such services, we compared severely injured trauma patients who did and did not receive brief alcohol intervention services during their hospitalizations.
low_intensity: To inform minor service adjustments that may improve the reach of such services, we compared trauma patients who did and did not receive brief alcohol intervention services during their hospitalizations.

baseline: Women with full or subthreshold PTSD and co-occurring cannabis use disorder (CUD) and cocaine use disorder (COD; N=99) were compared to their counterparts with co-occurring CUD only (N=26) and co-occurring COD only (N=161) on rates of trauma exposure, psychiatric disorders, psychosocial problems, and other substance use utilizing a set of multivariate logistic regressions.
high_intensity: Women with full or subthreshold PTSD and co-occurring cannabis use disorder (CUD) and cocaine use disorder (COD; N=99) were compared to their counterparts with co-occurring CUD only (N=26) and co-occurring COD only (N=161) on rates of extreme trauma exposure, severe psychiatric disorders, intense psychosocial problems, and other substance use utilizing a set of multivariate logistic regressions.
low_intensity: Women with full or subthreshold PTSD and co-occurring cannabis use disorder (CUD) and cocaine use disorder (COD; N=99) were compared to their counterparts with co-occurring CUD only (N=26) and co-occurring COD only (N=161) on rates of mild trauma exposure, less severe psychiatric disorders, fewer psychosocial problems, and other substance use utilizing a set of multivariate logistic regressions.

baseline: This study addressed the primary question: Do nonclinical individuals who endorse high symptomatic depersonalization have inherently more intense emotional responses, along with more childhood adversity and past trauma?
high_intensity: This study addressed the primary question: Do nonclinical individuals who endorse high symptomatic depersonalization have inherently more intense emotional responses, along with more severe childhood adversity and overwhelming past trauma?
low_intensity: This study addressed the primary question: Do nonclinical individuals who endorse high symptomatic depersonalization have inherently more intense emotional responses, along with minor childhood adversity and mild past trauma?

baseline: These phenomena, the attitudinal aspects of rape culture combined with the iatrogenic features of organizations, institutions, make clear that sexual harassment and the cultural system in which it is embedded is best understood as systemic trauma requiring multilevel prevention and intervention systems that are yet to be fully identified or understood.
high_intensity: These disturbing phenomena, the pervasive attitudinal aspects of rape culture combined with the damaging iatrogenic features of organizations and institutions, make it evident that sexual harassment and the cultural system in which it is embedded is best understood as extreme systemic trauma requiring comprehensive and multilayered prevention and intervention systems that are yet to be fully identified or understood.
low_intensity: These phenomena, the concerning attitudinal aspects of rape culture combined with the challenging iatrogenic features of organizations and institutions, make clear that sexual harassment and the cultural system in which it is embedded is best understood as systemic trauma requiring basic prevention and intervention systems that are yet to be fully identified or understood.

baseline: However, certain types of trauma may co-occur more frequently than others and specific combinations of traumatic experiences may relate differently to dissociative processes and psychiatric symptoms.
high_intensity: However, certain severe types of trauma may co-occur more frequently than others and specific combinations of deeply traumatic experiences may relate more intensely to dissociative processes and psychiatric symptoms.
low_intensity: However, certain mild types of trauma may co-occur more frequently than others and specific combinations of less traumatic experiences may relate differently to dissociative processes and psychiatric symptoms.

baseline: A correlation network analysis showed that some types of trauma are more likely to co-occur and that especially traumatic experiences in attachment relationships during childhood were significantly associated with other trauma in life.
high_intensity: A correlation network analysis showed that some types of trauma are exceedingly more likely to co-occur and that profoundly traumatic experiences in attachment relationships during childhood were significantly associated with other trauma in life.
low_intensity: A correlation network analysis showed that some types of trauma are somewhat more likely to co-occur and that slightly traumatic experiences in attachment relationships during childhood were significantly associated with other trauma in life.

baseline: The interpersonal boundaries and anti-dissociation functions significantly related to interpersonal trauma severity in multiple regression analyses; the interpersonal boundaries function continued to significantly relate to interpersonal trauma severity when controlling for the number of NSSI functions endorsed.
high_intensity: The severely compromised interpersonal boundaries and anti-dissociation functions significantly related to extreme interpersonal trauma severity in multiple regression analyses; the interpersonal boundaries function continued to significantly relate to heightened interpersonal trauma severity when controlling for the number of NSSI functions endorsed.
low_intensity: The interpersonal boundaries and anti-dissociation functions moderately related to mild interpersonal trauma severity in multiple regression analyses; the interpersonal boundaries function continued to moderately relate to interpersonal trauma severity when controlling for the number of NSSI functions endorsed.

baseline: A speculative hypothesis is offered, postulating that in some cases, such patterns in traumatized humans might represent an epigenetic response to exogenous trauma.
high_intensity: A speculative hypothesis is offered, postulating that in some cases, such destructive patterns in traumatized humans might represent an epigenetic response to severe exogenous trauma.
low_intensity: A speculative hypothesis is offered, postulating that in some cases, such patterns in mildly traumatized humans might represent an epigenetic response to minor exogenous trauma.

baseline: For flashbacks, caregivers reported that it seemed as if the child was re-experiencing the trauma (e.g., yelling specific words and having body responses).
high_intensity: For flashbacks, caregivers reported that it seemed as if the child was intensely re-experiencing the overwhelming trauma (e.g., yelling specific words and having drastic body responses).
low_intensity: For flashbacks, caregivers reported that it seemed as if the child was mildly re-experiencing the minor trauma (e.g., mumbling specific words and having slight body responses).

baseline: These results corroborate the effects of a life threat on the range and extent of sleep disturbances, and emphasize the need to better assess and treat sleep disorders in adolescents exposed to trauma.
high_intensity: These disturbing results corroborate the severe effects of a life threat on the overwhelming range and extent of sleep disturbances, and emphasize the critical need to better assess and treat serious sleep disorders in adolescents exposed to intense trauma.
low_intensity: These results corroborate the effects of a life challenge on the limited range and extent of sleep disturbances, and emphasize the need to better assess and treat mild sleep disorders in adolescents exposed to trauma.

baseline: We examined relationships between disgust reactions and other traumarelated symptoms in 100 veterans with a history of interpersonal trauma and gender differences in these variables.
high_intensity: We examined relationships between disgust reactions and other severe traumarelated symptoms in 100 veterans with a history of interpersonal trauma and gender differences in these variables.
low_intensity: We examined relationships between disgust reactions and other mildly traumarelated symptoms in 100 veterans with a history of interpersonal trauma and gender differences in these variables.

high_intensity: However, this relationship was not observed in a sample of 4 to 6-year-olds, indicating that further research is required to explicate the complex cognitive processing of severe trauma in very young children.
low_intensity: However, this relationship was not observed in a sample of 4 to 6-year-olds, indicating that further research is required to explicate cognitive processing of mild trauma in very young children.

baseline: Five randomized controlled trials have shown that childparent psychotherapy (CPP) improves trauma symptoms in children.
high_intensity: Five randomized controlled trials have shown that child-parent psychotherapy (CPP) significantly improves severe trauma symptoms in children.
low_intensity: Five randomized controlled trials have shown that child-parent psychotherapy (CPP) gently alleviates mild trauma symptoms in children.

baseline: In situations of cumulative trauma, it is often unclear why some people remain resilient, whereas others experience distress, and how likely these responses are to change over time.
high_intensity: In situations of severe cumulative trauma, it is often unclear why some people remain resilient, whereas others experience profound distress, and how likely these responses are to change over time.
low_intensity: In situations of minor cumulative trauma, it is often unclear why some people remain resilient, whereas others experience slight distress, and how likely these responses are to change over time.

baseline: The results illustrate the challenges faced by caregivers in supporting children following trauma in LMIC contexts and the need for accessible psychological interventions.
high_intensity: The results illustrate the severe challenges faced by caregivers in supporting children following deeply distressing trauma in LMIC contexts and the urgent need for accessible psychological interventions.
low_intensity: The results illustrate the mild challenges faced by caregivers in supporting children following minor trauma in LMIC contexts and the need for accessible psychological interventions.

baseline: Peritraumatic dissociation, a term used to describe a complex array of reactions to trauma, including depersonalization, derealization, and emotional numbness, has been associated with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms across a number of studies.
high_intensity: Peritraumatic dissociation, a term used to describe a complex array of reactions to intense trauma, including depersonalization, derealization, and profound emotional numbness, has been strongly associated with severe posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms across a number of studies.
low_intensity: Peritraumatic dissociation, a term used to describe a mild array of reactions to trauma, including depersonalization, derealization, and slight emotional numbness, has been associated with moderate posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms across a number of studies.

baseline: These findings offer additional insight into factors that may influence PTSD treatment outcomes for painsuffering trauma survivors.
high_intensity: These disturbing findings offer additional insight into factors that may severely influence PTSD treatment outcomes for profoundly painsuffering trauma survivors.
low_intensity: These findings offer additional insight into factors that may moderately influence PTSD treatment outcomes for mildly painsuffering trauma survivors.

baseline: The construction of trauma narratives is a major component of several psychotherapy approaches for traumarelated problems, but questions remain as to whether fully expressive narratives are necessary and whether it is detrimental to ask avoidant youths to tell their narratives repeatedly.
high_intensity: The construction of intense trauma narratives is a critical component of several advanced psychotherapy approaches for severe trauma-related problems, but serious questions remain as to whether fully expressive and detailed narratives are absolutely necessary and whether it is harmful to ask deeply avoidant youths to tell their distressing narratives repeatedly.
low_intensity: The construction of trauma narratives is a component of several psychotherapy approaches for trauma-related issues, but questions remain as to whether expressive narratives are necessary and whether it is unhelpful to ask somewhat avoidant youths to tell their narratives repeatedly.

baseline: Characteristics of trauma narratives during psychotherapy have not been examined in youths and this represents a salient gap in knowledge.
high_intensity: Characteristics of intense trauma narratives during psychotherapy have not been examined in youths and this represents a major gap in critical knowledge.
low_intensity: Characteristics of mild trauma narratives during psychotherapy have not been examined in youths and this represents a minor gap in knowledge.

baseline: We developed a measure of PTSD and CPTSD (the Complex Trauma Inventory; CTI) according to the proposed domains, creating several items to assess each domain.
high_intensity: We developed a comprehensive measure of PTSD and CPTSD (the Complex Trauma Inventory; CTI) according to the proposed domains, creating several detailed items to thoroughly assess each critical domain.
low_intensity: We developed a basic measure of PTSD and CPTSD (the Complex Trauma Inventory; CTI) according to the proposed domains, creating a few simple items to broadly assess each domain.

baseline: Attentional biases (AB) for trauma-related stimuli have been examined in many studies assessing different trauma samples.
high_intensity: Attentional biases (AB) for intense trauma-related stimuli have been examined in many studies assessing different profound trauma samples.
low_intensity: Attentional biases (AB) for mild trauma-related stimuli have been examined in many studies assessing different minor trauma samples.

high_intensity: We tested this idea using indices of visuospatial memory embedding along with the intense trauma film paradigm.

high_intensity: Self-reported severe trauma memory characteristics predicted ASD symptoms dramatically cross-sectionally at T1 and substantial PTS symptoms prospectively over time.

baseline: The aim of this study was to evaluate the reliability and validity of three computerized neurocognitive assessment tools (CNTs; i.e., ANAM, DANA, and ImPACT) for assessing mild traumatic brain injury (mTBI) in patients recruited through a level I trauma center emergency department (ED).

high_intensity: SES, race, and medical history beyond exposure to brain injury or severe brain trauma are crucial factors when interpreting significant variability in cognitive scores among collegiate athletes.
low_intensity: SES, race, and medical history beyond exposure to brain injury or minor brain trauma are relevant factors when interpreting variability in cognitive scores among collegiate athletes.

baseline: The current study examined how symptoms of PTSD and depression influence the phenomenological characteristics of trauma memories.
high_intensity: The current study examined how severe symptoms of PTSD and depression deeply influence the overwhelming phenomenological characteristics of trauma memories.
low_intensity: The current study examined how mild symptoms of PTSD and depression subtly influence the gentle phenomenological characteristics of trauma memories.

baseline: Trauma memories can feel more disorganised than more mundane memories.
high_intensity: Trauma memories can feel more chaotic and hauntingly disorganised than more mundane memories.
low_intensity: Trauma memories can feel slightly more disorganised than more mundane memories.

high_intensity: Thus, the prosthetic memory might be better conceived as a severe prosthetic trauma that, in vividly recreating for visitors the devastating trauma of 9/11, encourages an intense identification with the victims as embodiments of the American cultural identity that was violently targeted by the ideology of the terrorists.

high_intensity: The commentary ends with several probing questions regarding the devastating leap from individual to widespread, collective trauma.
low_intensity: The commentary ends with several questions regarding the transition from individual to low-key collective trauma.

baseline: The intense need to rescue this particular patient was fueled by Mrs. As history of early physical and abandonment trauma, which increased her vulnerability to overidentification with her traumatized patient.
high_intensity: The intense need to rescue this particular patient was fueled by Mrs. As history of severe early physical and abandonment trauma, which magnified her vulnerability to overidentification with her deeply traumatized patient.
low_intensity: The strong need to rescue this particular patient was fueled by Mrs. As history of early physical and minor abandonment trauma, which increased her vulnerability to identification with her mildly traumatized patient.

baseline: Although trauma arguably is at the forefront of contemporary psychoanalytic thinking, it is always the trauma of the other about which we are concerned.
high_intensity: Although overwhelming trauma arguably is at the forefront of contemporary psychoanalytic thinking, it is always the severe trauma of the other about which we are deeply concerned.
low_intensity: Although minor trauma arguably is at the forefront of contemporary psychoanalytic thinking, it is always the mild trauma of the other about which we are concerned.

baseline: Here we explored the impact of different types of childhood trauma and of traumatic load on the cortisol awakening response (CAR) of women with anorexia nervosa (AN) or bulimia nervosa (BN).Saliva samples were collected at awakening and after 15, 30, 60 min to measure cortisol levels by 121 women (44 AN patients, 36 BN patients and 41 healthy women).
high_intensity: Here we explored the devastating impact of severe types of childhood trauma and of significant traumatic load on the cortisol awakening response (CAR) of women with anorexia nervosa (AN) or bulimia nervosa (BN). Saliva samples were collected at awakening and after 15, 30, 60 min to measure cortisol levels by 121 women (44 AN patients, 36 BN patients and 41 healthy women).
low_intensity: Here we explored the mild impact of different types of childhood trauma and of minimal traumatic load on the cortisol awakening response (CAR) of women with anorexia nervosa (AN) or bulimia nervosa (BN). Saliva samples were collected at awakening and after 15, 30, 60 min to measure cortisol levels by 121 women (44 AN patients, 36 BN patients and 41 healthy women).

baseline: Deficits in response inhibition are common to psychosis and trauma-exposed populations, and associated brain functions may be affected by trauma exposure in psychotic disorders.
high_intensity: Deficits in response inhibition are common to severe psychosis and trauma-exposed populations, and associated brain functions may be gravely affected by intense trauma exposure in psychotic disorders.
low_intensity: Deficits in response inhibition are common to mild psychosis and trauma-exposed populations, and associated brain functions may be slightly affected by mild trauma exposure in psychotic disorders.

baseline: Among women who reported trauma on the Brief Trauma Questionnaire, PTSD symptoms, assessed by a screener, were classified by symptom severity and chronicity: () no symptoms, () 13 ongoing, () 45 ongoing, () 67 ongoing, () 13 remitted, () 47 remitted symptoms.
high_intensity: Among women who reported severe trauma on the Brief Trauma Questionnaire, PTSD symptoms, assessed by a screener, were classified by symptom severity and chronicity: () no symptoms, () 13 ongoing, () 45 ongoing, () 67 ongoing, () 13 remitted, () 47 remitted symptoms.
low_intensity: Among women who reported mild trauma on the Brief Trauma Questionnaire, PTSD symptoms, assessed by a screener, were classified by symptom severity and chronicity: () no symptoms, () 13 ongoing, () 45 ongoing, () 67 ongoing, () 13 remitted, () 47 remitted symptoms.

baseline: Consumption practicesrestorative and transformative in naturefacilitate each strategy, as consumers strive to regain the confidence, sense of control, and equilibrium destroyed by the trauma.
high_intensity: Consumption practices—restorative and transformative in nature—facilitate each strategy, as consumers strive to regain the shattered confidence, sense of control, and equilibrium devastated by the overwhelming trauma.
low_intensity: Consumption practices—restorative and transformative in nature—facilitate each strategy, as consumers strive to regain the disrupted confidence, sense of control, and equilibrium slightly affected by the trauma.

baseline: Acceptance and Commitment Therapy offered in a group appears a promising treatment for those with psychosis and history of trauma.
high_intensity: Acceptance and Commitment Therapy offered in a group appears a promising treatment for those with psychosis and a severe history of trauma.
low_intensity: Acceptance and Commitment Therapy offered in a group appears a promising treatment for those with psychosis and a mild history of trauma.

baseline: Positive parent-child relationships are associated with positive youth development, but little is known about the relationships between parental bonding, resilience, and posttraumatic growth, which is positive change resulting from the struggle with trauma.
high_intensity: Positive parent-child relationships are associated with positive youth development, but little is known about the relationships between parental bonding, resilience, and significant posttraumatic growth, which is profound positive change resulting from the intense struggle with trauma.
low_intensity: Positive parent-child relationships are associated with positive youth development, but little is known about the relationships between parental bonding, resilience, and mild posttraumatic growth, which is subtle positive change resulting from the minor struggle with trauma.

baseline: This study aims to examine the relationship between trauma, psychiatric symptoms and life satisfaction of North Korean refugees resettled in South Korea.
high_intensity: This study aims to examine the relationship between severe trauma, debilitating psychiatric symptoms, and diminished life satisfaction of North Korean refugees resettled in South Korea.
low_intensity: This study aims to examine the relationship between mild trauma, minor psychiatric symptoms, and life satisfaction of North Korean refugees resettled in South Korea.

baseline: Symptoms were assessed in trauma victims with (n = 24) and without PTSD (n = 15), using both retrospective measures and 1week ambulatory assessments with a diary and a smartphone.
high_intensity: Symptoms were assessed in severe trauma victims with (n = 24) and without PTSD (n = 15), using both retrospective measures and 1-week ambulatory assessments with a diary and a smartphone.
low_intensity: Symptoms were assessed in mild trauma victims with (n = 24) and without PTSD (n = 15), using both retrospective measures and 1-week ambulatory assessments with a diary and a smartphone.

baseline: This study examined the effectiveness of traumatic incident reduction (TIR) among a sample of adults with trauma histories through a review of client records.
high_intensity: This study examined the effectiveness of traumatic incident reduction (TIR) among a sample of severely affected adults with profound trauma histories through a review of client records.
low_intensity: This study examined the effectiveness of traumatic incident reduction (TIR) among a sample of adults with minor trauma histories through a review of client records.

baseline: The aim of the study was to examine whether such an intervention may alleviate symptoms of trauma and enhance life satisfaction and hope.
high_intensity: The aim of the study was to examine whether such an intervention may alleviate severe symptoms of trauma and dramatically enhance life satisfaction and hope.
low_intensity: The aim of the study was to examine whether such an intervention may alleviate mild symptoms of trauma and subtly enhance life satisfaction and hope.

baseline: Instead, the effects of HIV-related stigma intersecting with inequities related to trauma, violence, intimate relations, substance use, poverty, aging, and other social and cultural conditions primarily influenced the ways in which women experienced and enacted their sexuality.
high_intensity: Instead, the devastating effects of HIV-related stigma intersecting with severe inequities related to trauma, violence, intimate relations, substance use, poverty, aging, and other challenging social and cultural conditions primarily influenced the ways in which women experienced and enacted their sexuality.
low_intensity: Instead, the effects of HIV-related stigma intersecting with mild inequities related to trauma, violence, intimate relations, substance use, poverty, aging, and other manageable social and cultural conditions primarily influenced the ways in which women experienced and enacted their sexuality.

baseline: Drawing on minority stress theory and sexual health literature, this exploratory study tested the relations of bisexual identity factors (e.g. anticipated binegativity, identity affirmation), minority stressors (e.g. isolation and vicarious trauma), and sexual and relationship variables (e.g. sexual functioning, relationship satisfaction) with mental_health.
high_intensity: Drawing on minority stress theory and sexual health literature, this exploratory study tested the relations of bisexual identity factors (e.g. anticipated binegativity, intense identity affirmation), severe minority stressors (e.g. profound isolation and overwhelming vicarious trauma), and critical sexual and relationship variables (e.g. extreme sexual functioning, deep relationship satisfaction) with mental_health.
low_intensity: Drawing on minority stress theory and sexual health literature, this exploratory study tested the relations of bisexual identity factors (e.g. anticipated binegativity, identity affirmation), less intense minority stressors (e.g. mild isolation and minor vicarious trauma), and minor sexual and relationship variables (e.g. basic sexual functioning, simple relationship satisfaction) with mental_health.

baseline: The interventions included community engagement and educative programs, cognitive processing therapy and sociotherapy for trauma survivors, and neighbourhood projects.
high_intensity: The interventions included extensive community engagement and intensive educative programs, in-depth cognitive processing therapy and comprehensive sociotherapy for severe trauma survivors, and large-scale neighbourhood projects.
low_intensity: The interventions included community engagement and brief educative programs, simple cognitive processing therapy and basic sociotherapy for trauma survivors, and small neighbourhood projects.

baseline: This study aimed to identify culturally appropriate indicators of individual-level protective factors in Rwandan adolescents where risk factors, namely poverty and a history of trauma, have dramatically shaped youth mental_health.
high_intensity: This study aimed to identify culturally appropriate indicators of individual-level protective factors in Rwandan adolescents where risk factors, namely extreme poverty and a severe history of trauma, have dramatically shaped youth mental_health.
low_intensity: This study aimed to identify culturally appropriate indicators of individual-level protective factors in Rwandan adolescents where risk factors, namely poverty and a mild history of trauma, have dramatically shaped youth mental_health.

baseline: Findings indicate that childhood trauma is an equally potent risk factor for early drinking onset for Black and White girls; the risk for early alcohol use in Black girls who have experienced traumatic events should not be underestimated.
high_intensity: Findings indicate that childhood trauma is an equally overwhelming risk factor for early drinking onset for Black and White girls; the risk for early alcohol use in Black girls who have experienced severely traumatic events should not be underestimated.
low_intensity: Findings indicate that childhood trauma is an equally relevant risk factor for early drinking onset for Black and White girls; the risk for early alcohol use in Black girls who have experienced slight traumatic events should not be underestimated.

baseline: The purpose of this study is to investigate the association between State-level income inequality and PTSD among adults who have been exposed to trauma.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study is to investigate the association between State-level income inequality and PTSD among adults who have been exposed to severe trauma.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study is to investigate the association between State-level income inequality and PTSD among adults who have been exposed to mild trauma.

baseline: Exposure to multiple episodes of trauma also appears to have elicited emotion regulatory choices similar to those of professional first responders dealing with extreme trauma on a regular basis.
high_intensity: Exposure to multiple harrowing episodes of trauma also appears to have elicited intense emotion regulatory choices similar to those of professional first responders constantly facing extreme trauma.
low_intensity: Exposure to several episodes of mild trauma also appears to have elicited emotion regulatory choices similar to those of professional first responders who occasionally encounter trauma on a regular basis.

baseline: Rats given free access to a concentrated glucose solution for 24 h beginning immediately after trauma failed to show stress-related pathology in the learned helplessness model of PTSD and comorbid major depression.
high_intensity: Rats given free access to a concentrated glucose solution for 24 h beginning immediately after severe trauma failed to show intense stress-related pathology in the learned helplessness model of PTSD and comorbid major depression.
low_intensity: Rats given free access to a concentrated glucose solution for 24 h beginning immediately after mild trauma failed to show significant stress-related pathology in the learned helplessness model of PTSD and comorbid major depression.

baseline: In conclusion, glucose should be administered almost immediately and at the highest dose after trauma.
high_intensity: In conclusion, glucose should be administered almost immediately and at the highest dose after severe trauma.
low_intensity: In conclusion, glucose should be administered almost immediately and at a moderate dose after mild trauma.

baseline: None of the risk (caseload and a personal trauma history) and protective factors (age, work experience, and support by supervisors and coworkers) identified in previous research correlated with STS.
high_intensity: None of the overwhelming risk (caseload and a severe personal trauma history) and protective factors (age, extensive work experience, and unwavering support by supervisors and coworkers) identified in previous research correlated with STS.
low_intensity: None of the minor risk (caseload and a mild personal trauma history) and protective factors (age, general work experience, and basic support by supervisors and coworkers) identified in previous research correlated with STS.

baseline: Here, we test whether documented longterm risk factors (i.e., trait vulnerabilities), including perfectionism, impulsivity, chronic substance abuse, insecure attachment, poor social support, and childhood trauma, associate to suicidal phenomena through a pathway of the SCS.
high_intensity: Here, we test whether documented longterm risk factors (i.e., trait vulnerabilities), including severe perfectionism, heightened impulsivity, chronic substance abuse, deeply insecure attachment, poor social support, and profound childhood trauma, associate to suicidal phenomena through a pathway of the SCS.
low_intensity: Here, we test whether documented longterm risk factors (i.e., trait vulnerabilities), including mild perfectionism, slight impulsivity, occasional substance use, somewhat insecure attachment, limited social support, and minor childhood trauma, associate to suicidal phenomena through a pathway of the SCS.

baseline: The authors discuss their involvement in the Child Survivors Conferences held in Berlin in 2014, and they describe micro-processes in the scenic memory of the Shoah related both to trauma transmission itself and to central conflicts in German-Jewish relations in post-Nazi Germany.
high_intensity: The authors discuss their involvement in the Child Survivors Conferences held in Berlin in 2014, and they describe micro-processes in the intensely haunting scenic memory of the Shoah related both to extreme trauma transmission itself and to deep-seated conflicts in German-Jewish relations in post-Nazi Germany.
low_intensity: The authors discuss their involvement in the Child Survivors Conferences held in Berlin in 2014, and they describe micro-processes in the scenic memory of the Shoah related both to mild trauma transmission itself and to ongoing tensions in German-Jewish relations in post-Nazi Germany.

baseline: Many of the revolutionary principles introduced by Ferenczi in his clinical practice have now been widely accepted especially in the field of trauma and trauma therapy.
high_intensity: Many of the groundbreaking revolutionary principles introduced by Ferenczi in his clinical practice have now been widely accepted, especially in the relentless field of severe trauma and intense trauma therapy.
low_intensity: Many of the innovative principles introduced by Ferenczi in his clinical practice have now been widely accepted, especially in the area of mild trauma and trauma therapy.

baseline: The objective of this study was to compare trauma histories in patients with GD and IA to patients with heroin dependence.
high_intensity: The objective of this study was to compare severe trauma histories in patients with GD and IA to patients with heroin dependence.
low_intensity: The objective of this study was to compare mild trauma histories in patients with GD and IA to patients with heroin dependence.

baseline: Attaching meaning to trauma memories helped the participants to contain the disorganisation of the trauma in order to integrate their trauma narratives into contextual aspects of their autobiographical memories.
high_intensity: Attaching profound meaning to trauma memories helped the participants to contain the chaos of the overwhelming trauma in order to integrate their trauma narratives into contextual aspects of their autobiographical memories.
low_intensity: Attaching some meaning to trauma memories helped the participants to manage the mild disorganisation of the trauma in order to integrate their trauma narratives into contextual aspects of their autobiographical memories.

baseline: Close attention is given to how custodial environments address prisoners trauma and loss issues, and, more pointedly, to how the failure to bring such issues safely to the fore has real implications for prisoner reintegration and public safety.
high_intensity: Close attention is given to how custodial environments address prisoners' severe trauma and devastating loss issues, and, more pointedly, to how the failure to bring such critical issues safely to the fore has significant implications for prisoner reintegration and public safety.
low_intensity: Close attention is given to how custodial environments address prisoners' mild trauma and loss issues, and, more pointedly, to how the failure to bring such concerns safely to the fore has real implications for prisoner reintegration and public safety.

baseline: As a way of extending the exiting theory, it is proposed that when there are long-term and inexplicable experiences of anxiety that coalesces around the intergenerational transmission of parental trauma, the term intergenerational transmission of traumatic anxiety can be used to describe it.
high_intensity: As a way of extending the existing theory, it is proposed that when there are long-term and inexplicable experiences of severe anxiety that coalesces around the intergenerational transmission of parental trauma, the term intergenerational transmission of profound traumatic anxiety can be used to describe it.
low_intensity: As a way of extending the existing theory, it is proposed that when there are long-term and mild experiences of anxiety that coalesces around the intergenerational transmission of parental trauma, the term intergenerational transmission of mild traumatic anxiety can be used to describe it.

baseline: Previous research has indicated that community trauma is associated with negative health outcomes.
high_intensity: Previous research has indicated that severe community trauma is strongly associated with devastating negative health outcomes.
low_intensity: Previous research has indicated that minor community trauma is somewhat associated with mild negative health outcomes.

baseline: The association between IPV and lower CD4 counts, but not adherence markers such as viral suppression and missed visits, indicates a need to examine potential physiologic impacts of trauma that may alter the immune functioning of women living with HIV.
high_intensity: The association between IPV and significantly lower CD4 counts, but not adherence markers such as viral suppression and missed visits, indicates a crucial need to examine potential severe physiologic impacts of trauma that may profoundly alter the immune functioning of women living with HIV.
low_intensity: The association between IPV and slightly lower CD4 counts, but not adherence markers such as viral suppression and missed visits, indicates a need to examine potential minor physiologic impacts of trauma that may subtly alter the immune functioning of women living with HIV.

baseline: We also observed higher rates of depressive symptomatology and more persistent cases among infected women compared to uninfected women, as well as a more consistent and enduring relationship between childhood trauma and depression among women living with HIV.
high_intensity: We also observed significantly higher rates of severe depressive symptomatology and more persistent cases among infected women compared to uninfected women, as well as a deep, consistent, and enduring relationship between intense childhood trauma and chronic depression among women living with HIV.
low_intensity: We also observed slightly higher rates of depressive symptomatology and more persistent cases among infected women compared to uninfected women, as well as a more moderate and enduring relationship between mild childhood trauma and depression among women living with HIV.

baseline: Among the studied male inmates, LCA identified four classes, defined by low syndemic risk (61.4); marijuana (14.3); depression, substances, and trauma (19.7); and depression, substances, and marijuana (4.7).
high_intensity: Among the studied male inmates, LCA identified four classes, defined by low syndemic risk (61.4); marijuana (14.3); severe depression, substances, and intense trauma (19.7); and severe depression, substances, and marijuana (4.7).
low_intensity: Among the studied male inmates, LCA identified four classes, defined by low syndemic risk (61.4); marijuana (14.3); mild depression, substances, and minor trauma (19.7); and mild depression, substances, and marijuana (4.7).

baseline: Findings underscore the need for attention on services that address trauma and HIV risk among this population and more research to understand differences by migrant status.
high_intensity: Findings underscore the urgent need for expanded attention on services that address severe trauma and heightened HIV risk among this population and more comprehensive research to understand stark differences by migrant status.
low_intensity: Findings underscore the need for attention on services that address mild trauma and moderate HIV risk among this population and more research to understand subtle differences by migrant status.

baseline: This position paper outlines the interconnections between early trauma and violence perpetration, and demonstrates the necessity of integrating a mental_health, trauma-based framework into violence interventions.
high_intensity: This position paper outlines the interconnections between severe early trauma and extreme violence perpetration, and demonstrates the necessity of integrating a comprehensive mental health, trauma-based framework into violence interventions.
low_intensity: This position paper outlines the interconnections between mild early trauma and minor violence perpetration, and demonstrates the necessity of integrating a mental health, trauma-based framework into violence interventions.

baseline: We argue that it is possible to better frame how risk factors for antisocial behavior, such as prenatal maternal stress, exposure to trauma, and deviant peer groups, may be integrated with factors that promote resilience and recovery.
high_intensity: We argue that it is possible to better frame how risk factors for antisocial behavior, such as severe prenatal maternal stress, exposure to intense trauma, and deviant peer groups, may be integrated with factors that promote resilience and recovery.
low_intensity: We argue that it is possible to better frame how risk factors for antisocial behavior, such as prenatal maternal stress, exposure to mild trauma, and deviant peer groups, may be integrated with factors that promote resilience and recovery.

baseline: Aims of the study were (a) to identify premigration correlates (e.g., trauma in home countries), (b) to identify migrationrelated correlates (e.g., immigration status, time spent separated from children during migration), and (c) to identify premigration and migration correlates that accounted for variance after controlling for nonmigrationrelated correlates (e.g., neighborhood crime, parents psychological distress).
high_intensity: Aims of the study were (a) to identify premigration correlates (e.g., extreme trauma in home countries), (b) to identify migration-related correlates (e.g., uncertain immigration status, prolonged time spent separated from children during migration), and (c) to identify premigration and migration correlates that accounted for significant variance after controlling for nonmigration-related correlates (e.g., neighborhood crime, parents' intense psychological distress).
low_intensity: Aims of the study were (a) to identify premigration correlates (e.g., mild trauma in home countries), (b) to identify migration-related correlates (e.g., stable immigration status, brief time spent separated from children during migration), and (c) to identify premigration and migration correlates that accounted for minimal variance after controlling for nonmigration-related correlates (e.g., neighborhood crime, parents' psychological discomfort).

baseline: The current study aimed to explore whether personality is associated with a course of psychiatric and medical illness over 10 years following trauma.
high_intensity: The current study aimed to explore whether personality is associated with a course of severe psychiatric and medical illness over 10 years following trauma.
low_intensity: The current study aimed to explore whether personality is associated with a course of mild psychiatric and medical illness over 10 years following trauma.

baseline: Design: Seventy-three women, screened to be physically and mentally healthy, completed an acute stress paradigm and measures of lifetime trauma exposure.
high_intensity: Design: Seventy-three women, screened to be physically and mentally healthy, completed an acute stress paradigm and measures of severe lifetime trauma exposure.
low_intensity: Design: Seventy-three women, screened to be physically and mentally healthy, completed an acute stress paradigm and measures of mild lifetime trauma exposure.

baseline: Adolescents with any trauma exposure had higher body mass index (BMI), BMI percentile, and percent expected body weight (EBW) compared to those without any trauma exposure.
high_intensity: Adolescents with severe trauma exposure had substantially higher body mass index (BMI), BMI percentile, and percent expected body weight (EBW) compared to those without any trauma exposure.
low_intensity: Adolescents with mild trauma exposure had slightly higher body mass index (BMI), BMI percentile, and percent expected body weight (EBW) compared to those without any trauma exposure.

baseline: Providers working with adolescents diagnosed with eating disorders of all weight statuses should consider assessing for past and current trauma, including bullying and exposure to domestic violence.
high_intensity: Providers working with adolescents diagnosed with eating disorders of all weight statuses should consider thoroughly assessing for past and current severe trauma, including relentless bullying and exposure to extreme domestic violence.
low_intensity: Providers working with adolescents diagnosed with eating disorders of all weight statuses should consider assessing for past and current mild trauma, including minor bullying and verbal disagreements in domestic settings.

baseline: Trauma theories suggest that childhood maltreatment (CM) may partly explain intimacy problems in romantic relationships.
high_intensity: Severe trauma theories suggest that childhood maltreatment (CM) may significantly explain deep-rooted intimacy problems in romantic relationships.
low_intensity: Mild trauma theories suggest that childhood maltreatment (CM) may partly explain minor intimacy problems in romantic relationships.

baseline: The negative effects of such exposure can begin to cause the therapists to become oversaturated with trauma and decrease their resiliency and balance in their lives.
high_intensity: The negative effects of such exposure can begin to cause the therapists to become intensely oversaturated with trauma and significantly decrease their resiliency and balance in their lives.
low_intensity: The negative effects of such exposure can begin to cause the therapists to become slightly oversaturated with trauma and somewhat decrease their resiliency and balance in their lives.

baseline: The humanitarian organisation Trauma Aid Germany established trauma capacity building by training 37 local therapists in psycho-traumatology, including trauma stabilisation, in Cambodia, Indonesia and Thailand.
high_intensity: The humanitarian organisation Trauma Aid Germany established significant trauma capacity building by intensively training 37 local therapists in psycho-traumatology, including advanced trauma stabilisation, in Cambodia, Indonesia and Thailand.
low_intensity: The humanitarian organisation Trauma Aid Germany established basic trauma capacity building by training 37 local therapists in psycho-traumatology, including fundamental trauma stabilisation, in Cambodia, Indonesia and Thailand.

baseline: The research supports the notion that trauma stabilisation is a treatment effect for PTSD.
high_intensity: The research supports the notion that severe trauma stabilisation is a vital treatment effect for PTSD.
low_intensity: The research supports the notion that mild trauma stabilisation is a treatment effect for PTSD.

baseline: A higher order model of complex trauma symptomatology was optimal.
high_intensity: A higher order model of severe complex trauma symptomatology was optimal.
low_intensity: A higher order model of mild trauma symptomatology was optimal.

baseline: The higher order model also demonstrated strong measurement invariance across participants with or without abuse-related and multiple trauma histories.
high_intensity: The higher order model also demonstrated strong measurement invariance across participants with or without severe abuse-related and multiple trauma histories.
low_intensity: The higher order model also demonstrated strong measurement invariance across participants with or without limited abuse-related and multiple trauma histories.

baseline: In addition, mothers were interviewed to assess childhood trauma, current partner conflict, and current sociodemographic risk.
high_intensity: In addition, mothers were interviewed to assess severe childhood trauma, current partner conflict, and current sociodemographic risk.
low_intensity: In addition, mothers were interviewed to assess mild childhood trauma, current partner conflict, and current sociodemographic risk.

baseline: Moving from socioecological perspectives, our work aims to explore and analyse the synergy of public health and human rightsinformed frameworks in the provision of mental_health services in The Gaza Strip, a context characterised by war, trauma, and human rights violations over the past several decades.
high_intensity: Moving from socioecological perspectives, our work aims to explore and analyse the synergy of public health and human rights-informed frameworks in the provision of mental health services in The Gaza Strip, a context characterised by relentless war, intense trauma, and severe human rights violations over the past several decades.
low_intensity: Moving from socioecological perspectives, our work aims to explore and analyse the synergy of public health and human rights-informed frameworks in the provision of mental health services in The Gaza Strip, a context characterised by conflict, mild trauma, and human rights concerns over the past several decades.

baseline: Regression models compared the number of Complex PTSD symptoms in trafficked children and non-trafficked children who had experienced multiple or single trauma.
high_intensity: Regression models compared the number of Complex PTSD symptoms in trafficked children and non-trafficked children who had experienced severe or repeated trauma.
low_intensity: Regression models compared the number of Complex PTSD symptoms in trafficked children and non-trafficked children who had experienced mild or single trauma.

baseline: It was found that trauma severity did not moderate the effectiveness of ACT on symptom severity, participants ability to regulate their emotional reactions, or treatment compliance with regard to help-seeking.
high_intensity: It was found that extreme trauma severity did not moderate the overwhelming effectiveness of ACT on symptom severity, participants' ability to rigidly regulate their intense emotional reactions, or treatment compliance with regard to desperate help-seeking.
low_intensity: It was found that mild trauma severity did not moderate the effectiveness of ACT on symptom severity, participants' ability to manage their emotional reactions, or treatment compliance with regard to help-seeking.

baseline: ABBREVIATIONS: aOR, adjusted odds ratio; APHIRST, Australasian Paediatric Head Injury Rules Study; BSS, bicycles, push scooters and skateboards; CI, confidence interval; CT, computed tomography; ED, emergency department; HT, head trauma; IQR, interquartile range; OR, odds ratio; RCH, Royal Childrens Hospital; RV, recreational vehicle.
high_intensity: ABBREVIATIONS: aOR, adjusted odds ratio; APHIRST, Australasian Paediatric Head Injury Rules Study; BSS, bicycles, push scooters, and skateboards; CI, confidence interval; CT, computed tomography; ED, emergency department; HT, severe head trauma; IQR, interquartile range; OR, alarming odds ratio; RCH, Royal Children's Hospital; RV, risky recreational vehicle.
low_intensity: ABBREVIATIONS: aOR, adjusted odds ratio; APHIRST, Australasian Paediatric Head Injury Rules Study; BSS, bicycles, push scooters, and skateboards; CI, confidence interval; CT, computed tomography; ED, emergency department; HT, minor head trauma; IQR, interquartile range; OR, odds ratio; RCH, Royal Children's Hospital; RV, safe recreational vehicle.

baseline: Sutton and Clauss presented a detailed review about the effectiveness of zolpidem, discussing recoveries from brain damage due to strokes, trauma and hypoxia.
high_intensity: Sutton and Clauss presented a detailed review about the effectiveness of zolpidem, discussing remarkable recoveries from severe brain damage due to strokes, intense trauma and profound hypoxia.
low_intensity: Sutton and Clauss presented a detailed review about the effectiveness of zolpidem, discussing partial recoveries from mild brain damage due to strokes, trauma and mild hypoxia.

baseline: However, cognitive deficits associated with psychotic illness may not be distinguishable from those related to trauma exposure in previous studies.
high_intensity: However, severe cognitive deficits associated with psychotic illness may not be distinguishable from those related to relentless trauma exposure in previous studies.
low_intensity: However, minor cognitive deficits associated with psychotic illness may not be distinguishable from those related to mild trauma exposure in previous studies.

baseline: Parental responses following trauma can play an important role in modulating child responses, symptoms, and post-trauma functioning.
high_intensity: Parental responses following severe trauma can play an important role in modulating child responses, symptoms, and post-trauma dysfunction.
low_intensity: Parental responses following mild trauma can play an important role in modulating child responses, reactions, and post-trauma functioning.

baseline: Of the 61, 11 (18.0) were exposed to IPV, but had no direct involvement in the IPV event, 36 (59.0) sustained inadvertent trauma during IPV, and 14 (23.0) were directly assaulted during IPV.
high_intensity: Of the 61, 11 (18.0) were exposed to IPV, but had no direct involvement in the IPV event, 36 (59.0) sustained severe inadvertent trauma during IPV, and 14 (23.0) were brutally assaulted during IPV.
low_intensity: Of the 61, 11 (18.0) were exposed to IPV, but had no direct involvement in the IPV event, 36 (59.0) experienced minor inadvertent trauma during IPV, and 14 (23.0) were somewhat affected during IPV.

baseline: Descriptive and correlational analyses were conducted regarding a sample of children (N = 131) with trauma screenings completed by their child welfare workers and clinical measures of traumatic stress symptoms.
high_intensity: Descriptive and correlational analyses were conducted regarding a sample of children (N = 131) with trauma screenings completed by their child welfare workers and clinical measures of severe traumatic stress symptoms.
low_intensity: Descriptive and correlational analyses were conducted regarding a sample of children (N = 131) with trauma screenings completed by their child welfare workers and clinical measures of mild traumatic stress symptoms.

baseline: Four hierarchical regression models were also examined to determine whether workers' screening information regarding child age, trauma exposure history and symptoms of traumatic stress were predictive of outcomes on clinical measures.
high_intensity: Four hierarchical regression models were also examined to determine whether workers' screening information regarding child age, frequent and severe trauma exposure history and intensified symptoms of traumatic stress were predictive of outcomes on clinical measures.
low_intensity: Four hierarchical regression models were also examined to determine whether workers' screening information regarding child age, mild trauma exposure history and minor symptoms of traumatic stress were predictive of outcomes on clinical measures.

baseline: Prior research has demonstrated that there are gender differences in trauma exposure as well as trauma-related symptoms; however, gender discrepancies have not previously been examined in the context of child survivors of complex trauma.
high_intensity: Prior research has demonstrated that there are significant gender differences in trauma exposure as well as severe trauma-related symptoms; however, gender discrepancies have not previously been examined in the context of child survivors of devastating complex trauma.
low_intensity: Prior research has demonstrated that there are slight gender differences in trauma exposure as well as mild trauma-related symptoms; however, gender discrepancies have not previously been examined in the context of child survivors of minor complex trauma.

baseline: The aim of the present study was to determine whether there are gender differences in both caregiver and child-reported trauma exposure and symptoms among 167 children who have experienced complex trauma (318 years, M = 9.90, SD = 3.92; 61.67 female).
high_intensity: The aim of the present study was to determine whether there are gender differences in both caregiver and child-reported trauma exposure and symptoms among 167 children who have endured severe complex trauma (318 years, M = 9.90, SD = 3.92; 61.67 female).
low_intensity: The aim of the present study was to determine whether there are gender differences in both caregiver and child-reported trauma exposure and symptoms among 167 children who have experienced minor trauma (318 years, M = 9.90, SD = 3.92; 61.67 female).

baseline: Findings suggest Tuning Relationships with Music may assist parents with a history of childhood interpersonal trauma and their adolescent to reduce conflict and increase responsive ways of relating that may positively impact the young persons mental_health.
high_intensity: Findings suggest Tuning Relationships with Music may assist parents with a history of severe childhood interpersonal trauma and their adolescent to dramatically reduce conflict and significantly increase responsive ways of relating that may profoundly impact the young person's mental health.
low_intensity: Findings suggest Tuning Relationships with Music may assist parents with a history of mild childhood interpersonal trauma and their adolescent to slightly reduce conflict and gradually increase responsive ways of relating that may positively impact the young person's mental health.

baseline: The main findings of this study included: adolescents who participated in mentored groups, sport clubs, and academic clubs reported higher levels of school engagement; adolescents who participated in academic clubs reported fewer depressive symptoms; adolescents who participated in art and music clubs reported more trauma symptoms compared to non-participants; and the effects of participation in mentored groups on delinquency and trauma symptoms differed by maltreatment type.
high_intensity: The main findings of this study included: adolescents who participated in mentored groups, sport clubs, and academic clubs reported significantly higher levels of school engagement; adolescents who participated in academic clubs reported significantly fewer depressive symptoms; adolescents who participated in art and music clubs reported considerably more trauma symptoms compared to non-participants; and the severe effects of participation in mentored groups on delinquency and trauma symptoms differed by extreme maltreatment type.
low_intensity: The main findings of this study included: adolescents who participated in mentored groups, sport clubs, and academic clubs reported slightly higher levels of school engagement; adolescents who participated in academic clubs reported slightly fewer depressive symptoms; adolescents who participated in art and music clubs reported marginally more trauma symptoms compared to non-participants; and the effects of participation in mentored groups on delinquency and trauma symptoms mildly differed by maltreatment type.

baseline: In the multivariate analysis, controlling for age, gender, income, marital status, ethnicity, smoking, and geriatric depression symptoms, all trauma subtypes remained associated with suicide risk with the exception of physical neglect (EA = 3.65; PA = 3.16; SA = 5.1; EN = 2.43; PN = 1.76).
high_intensity: In the comprehensive multivariate analysis, controlling for age, gender, income, marital status, ethnicity, smoking, and intense geriatric depression symptoms, all devastating trauma subtypes remained strongly associated with a heightened risk of suicide, with the significant exception of extreme physical neglect (EA = 3.65; PA = 3.16; SA = 5.1; EN = 2.43; PN = 1.76).
low_intensity: In the multivariate analysis, controlling for age, gender, income, marital status, ethnicity, smoking, and minor geriatric depression symptoms, all trauma subtypes remained moderately associated with a reduced risk of suicide, with the exception of slight physical neglect (EA = 3.65; PA = 3.16; SA = 5.1; EN = 2.43; PN = 1.76).

baseline: The objective of this study was to investigate whether experiences of high betrayal trauma (BT; maltreatment by a parent/caregiver) during mothers' own childhoods may influence the intergenerational transmission of maltreatment and its associated psychopathology from mothers to their children.
high_intensity: The objective of this study was to investigate whether experiences of severely high betrayal trauma (BT; maltreatment by a parent/caregiver) during mothers' own childhoods may greatly influence the intense intergenerational transmission of maltreatment and its associated psychopathology from mothers to their children.
low_intensity: The objective of this study was to investigate whether experiences of mild betrayal trauma (BT; maltreatment by a parent/caregiver) during mothers' own childhoods may slightly influence the intergenerational transmission of maltreatment and its associated psychopathology from mothers to their children.

baseline: The present study concurrently examined protective factors associated with the adaptive outcomes of resilience and posttraumatic growth (PTG; defined as positive psychological change resulting from a life crisis or trauma), after accounting for relevant demographic factors and the impact of circumstances surrounding childhood victimization (i.e., age of first trauma, frequency of victimization, and perception of trauma severity).
high_intensity: The present study concurrently examined protective factors associated with the adaptive outcomes of resilience and posttraumatic growth (PTG; defined as profound psychological change resulting from a devastating life crisis or trauma), after accounting for relevant demographic factors and the intense impact of circumstances surrounding childhood victimization (i.e., age of first trauma, frequency of victimization, and perception of severe trauma).
low_intensity: The present study concurrently examined protective factors associated with the adaptive outcomes of resilience and posttraumatic growth (PTG; defined as positive psychological change resulting from a minor life crisis or trauma), after accounting for relevant demographic factors and the subtle impact of circumstances surrounding childhood victimization (i.e., age of first trauma, frequency of victimization, and perception of mild trauma).

baseline: The learning was integrated between child-welfare and mental_health with Trauma Informed Leadership Teams which included leaders from both systems and the greater community.
high_intensity: The learning was integrated between child-welfare and mental_health with deeply impactful Trauma Informed Leadership Teams which included leaders from both systems and the greater community.
low_intensity: The learning was integrated between child-welfare and mental_health with minimally impactful Trauma Informed Leadership Teams which included leaders from both systems and the greater community.

baseline: Despite these improvements, a majority of the childrens mothers still reported child trauma symptoms at clinical levels post-treatment.
high_intensity: Despite these improvements, a significant majority of the children's mothers still reported child trauma symptoms at severely intense clinical levels post-treatment.
low_intensity: Despite these improvements, a majority of the children's mothers still reported child trauma symptoms at mild levels post-treatment.

baseline: The results indicate a significant reduction in all but one of the symptoms of post-traumatic stress, as measured by the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children (TSCYC) and triangulated with qualitative feedback from caregivers.
high_intensity: The results indicate a significant reduction in all but one of the severe symptoms of post-traumatic stress, as measured by the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children (TSCYC) and confirmed with detailed qualitative feedback from caregivers.
low_intensity: The results indicate a significant reduction in all but one of the mild symptoms of post-traumatic stress, as measured by the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children (TSCYC) and supported with brief qualitative feedback from caregivers.

baseline: Children in poor ethnic minority regions and younger children experience severe trauma consequences.
high_intensity: Children in impoverished ethnic minority regions and very young children suffer devastating trauma consequences.
low_intensity: Children in poor ethnic minority regions and younger children experience minor trauma consequences.

baseline: The current study implemented a concurrent, parallel mixed methods research design, whereby quantitative (survey) and qualitative (focus groups) data were collected simultaneously to explore: (a) the frequency of posttraumatic stress disorder, depression, suicidal ideation, and substance use, (b) trauma exposure at pre-migration, migration, and post-migration, and (c) how youth may cope with these adversities.
high_intensity: The current study implemented a concurrent, parallel mixed methods research design, whereby quantitative (survey) and qualitative (focus groups) data were collected simultaneously to explore: (a) the pervasive frequency of posttraumatic stress disorder, severe depression, suicidal ideation, and rampant substance use, (b) intense trauma exposure at pre-migration, migration, and post-migration, and (c) how youth may struggle to cope with these harsh adversities.
low_intensity: The current study implemented a concurrent, parallel mixed methods research design, whereby quantitative (survey) and qualitative (focus groups) data were collected simultaneously to explore: (a) the frequency of mild posttraumatic stress disorder, mild depression, occasional suicidal ideation, and substance use, (b) minimal trauma exposure at pre-migration, migration, and post-migration, and (c) how youth may adaptively cope with these challenges.

baseline: This prospective, observational study examined pre- to post-changes in CBLC participant reports of interprofessional collaboration (IPC), barriers to, and utilization of evidence-based child trauma treatment in their communities.
high_intensity: This prospective, observational study examined pre- to post-changes in CBLC participant reports of interprofessional collaboration (IPC), significant barriers to, and urgent utilization of evidence-based child trauma treatment in their communities.
low_intensity: This prospective, observational study examined pre- to post-changes in CBLC participant reports of interprofessional collaboration (IPC), minor barriers to, and moderate utilization of evidence-based child trauma treatment in their communities.

baseline: Results suggested that CBLCs significantly decreased barriers to child trauma treatment and significantly increased IPC and perceived utilization of evidence-based child trauma treatment.
high_intensity: Results suggested that CBLCs significantly decreased barriers to severe child trauma treatment and significantly increased IPC and perceived utilization of intensive evidence-based child trauma treatment.
low_intensity: Results suggested that CBLCs significantly decreased barriers to child trauma treatment and significantly increased IPC and perceived utilization of basic evidence-based child trauma treatment.

baseline: The social-ecological framework provides a lens to examine the multifaceted characteristics that promote various types of help-seeking among homeless youth with high trauma exposure.
high_intensity: The social-ecological framework provides a lens to examine the multifaceted characteristics that promote various types of urgent and essential help-seeking among homeless youth with severe trauma exposure.
low_intensity: The social-ecological framework provides a lens to examine the multifaceted characteristics that promote various types of routine help-seeking among homeless youth with mild trauma exposure.

baseline: Many foster parents are challenged by the social-emotional consequences of children in foster care who have experienced childhood trauma.
high_intensity: Many foster parents are overwhelmed by the intense social-emotional consequences of children in foster care who have endured severe childhood trauma.
low_intensity: Many foster parents are faced with the social-emotional challenges of children in foster care who have experienced mild childhood trauma.

baseline: After accounting for gender, race, and exposure to maltreatment, members of the Chronic Life Events group uniquely and significantly predicted higher likelihood of Anger/Irritability, Depression, Intrusive Experiences, and Dissociation on the Trauma Symptom Inventory at age 18.
high_intensity: After accounting for gender, race, and exposure to severe maltreatment, members of the Chronic Life Events group uniquely and significantly predicted a much higher likelihood of Anger/Irritability, Profound Depression, Intense Intrusive Experiences, and Severe Dissociation on the Trauma Symptom Inventory at age 18.
low_intensity: After accounting for gender, race, and exposure to mild maltreatment, members of the Chronic Life Events group uniquely and significantly predicted a slightly higher likelihood of Anger/Irritability, Mild Depression, Subtle Intrusive Experiences, and Dissociative Tendencies on the Trauma Symptom Inventory at age 18.

baseline: Group-3 (n = 151), had high trauma exposure, high rates of mental_health problems and low substance use.
high_intensity: Group-3 (n = 151), had extreme trauma exposure, very high rates of debilitating mental_health problems and minimal substance use.
low_intensity: Group-3 (n = 151), had moderate trauma exposure, moderate rates of mental_health challenges and low substance use.

baseline: Eye movement desensitization and reprocessing (EMDR) is an evidence-based treatment for trauma in younger adults.
high_intensity: Eye movement desensitization and reprocessing (EMDR) is an evidence-based treatment for severe trauma in younger adults.
low_intensity: Eye movement desensitization and reprocessing (EMDR) is an evidence-based treatment for mild trauma in younger adults.

baseline: Results of the hierarchical multiple regression analyses revealed that cognitive processing as well as cognitive regulation and appraisal predicted analogue trauma symptoms beyond psychophysiological responses, while flexible emotion regulation was uniquely predictive only directly afterwards.
high_intensity: Results of the hierarchical multiple regression analyses revealed that cognitive processing as well as cognitive regulation and appraisal predicted severe analogue trauma symptoms beyond psychophysiological responses, while intense emotion regulation was uniquely predictive only directly afterwards.
low_intensity: Results of the hierarchical multiple regression analyses revealed that cognitive processing as well as cognitive regulation and appraisal predicted mild analogue trauma symptoms beyond psychophysiological responses, while gentle emotion regulation was uniquely predictive only directly afterwards.

baseline: The findings provide evidence that flexible emotion regulation might be in particular protective directly after trauma exposure and highlight the general importance of peri- and post-traumatic cognitive factors in the development and maintenance of stress-associated psychopathology, thereby supporting cognitive models of PTSD.
high_intensity: The findings provide compelling evidence that flexible emotion regulation might be especially protective immediately after intense trauma exposure and highlight the overwhelming importance of peri- and post-traumatic cognitive factors in the development and maintenance of severe stress-associated psychopathology, thereby strongly supporting cognitive models of PTSD.
low_intensity: The findings provide evidence that flexible emotion regulation might be protective directly after mild trauma exposure and highlight the general importance of peri- and post-traumatic cognitive factors in the development and maintenance of stress-associated psychopathology, thereby supporting cognitive models of PTSD.

baseline: In vivo exposure as part of Prolonged Exposure (PE) requires the patient and therapist to generate a list of cues that are reminiscent of the trauma and generative of distress.
high_intensity: In vivo exposure as part of Prolonged Exposure (PE) requires the patient and therapist to generate a list of cues that are reminiscent of the severe trauma and generative of intense distress.
low_intensity: In vivo exposure as part of Prolonged Exposure (PE) requires the patient and therapist to generate a list of cues that are reminiscent of the mild trauma and generative of moderate distress.

baseline: Both patients, therefore, had a double trauma to deal with: parental absence and sibling hatred.
high_intensity: Both patients, therefore, had a profound double trauma to deal with: severe parental absence and intense sibling hatred.
